conclusion: The problem involves four blocks (A, B, C, and D) connected by a spring that is always within its elastic limit. The blocks are moving with an acceleration 'a' due to a horizontal force F applied to block B.
The spring provides the necessary force between blocks C and B to maintain their acceleration.

premise: Since all four blocks move together with the same acceleration 'a', the net force acting on the system should be equal to the mass of the system times the acceleration.

conclusion: Forces on individual blocks: Block B has force F from the left, spring force F_s to the right, and no friction force from the wall.
Block A has force F_s from the right and friction force f_AB.
Block C has force F_s from the left and friction force f_CD.
Block D has friction force f_DC and no external forces besides friction.

premise: The total force on B is the applied force minus the force from the spring: F - F_s = ma
The force from the spring pulls C to the right: F_s = 4ma
Since there is no external force on C other than the spring force and friction, the frictional force f_CD must balance the spring force.
The frictional force from Block C on D is equal and opposite to the force from Block C.
Under the action of the horizontal pulling force F, the four wooden blocks accelerate together with the same acceleration.
